header.title: How to use the CG-3 parser vislcg3

section.title: How to use the vislcg3 parser
Basic usage
section.note: This page is incomplete. Consult the vislcg3 documentation as well as these notes.
section.p: The command line looks like this (for sme, supposing you stand in the sme directory):
section.source: sme$ cat sometext.txt | preprocess --abbr=bin/abbr.txt | lookup -flags mbTT bin/sme.fst | ../script/lookup2cg | vislcg3 -g src/sme-dis.rle | less

section.title: Flags and their use
section.p: The vislcg3 program contains a large number of flags, or usage options. A list of the flags may be obtained by writing the following command:
i.e., by using the flag --help. The most relevant flags for our use are the following:

dl.dd: This flag selects the grammar file
This flag sets the number of CONSTRAINT sections that are applied. In this way it is possible to study the effects of one rule set at a time.
This flag tells the parser to include information of what constraint rules are invoked in each concrete case. The flag is crucial for studying the effects of the different rules.
